1// devela::sys::env::arg::os_ref
2//
3//! Defines [`IterArgsOsRef`] and [`args_os_ref_iter()`].
4//
5// WAIT: [macos build fails](https://github.com/dtolnay/argv/issues/1)
6
7use crate::OsStr;
8
9/// Returns an iterator over command line arguments.
10pub(crate) fn args_os_ref_iter() -> IterArgsOsRef {
11    IterArgsOsRef { platform_specific: r#impl::args_os_ref_iter() }
12}
13
14#[doc = crate::TAG_ITERATOR!()]
15#[doc = crate::_doc_miri_warn!(tag)]
16/// Iterator over references of command line arguments.
17///
18/// See [`Env::args_os_ref()`][crate::Env#method.args_os_ref].
19#[doc = crate::_doc!(vendor: "argv")]
20#[derive(Debug)]
21pub struct IterArgsOsRef {
22    platform_specific: r#impl::IterArgsOsRef,
23}
24
25impl Iterator for IterArgsOsRef {
26    type Item = &'static OsStr;
27
28    fn next(&mut self) -> Option<Self::Item> {
29        self.platform_specific.next()
30    }
31    fn size_hint(&self) -> (usize, Option<usize>) {
32        self.platform_specific.size_hint()
33    }
34}
35
36impl ExactSizeIterator for IterArgsOsRef {
37    fn len(&self) -> usize {
38        self.platform_specific.len()
39    }
40}
41
42// NOTE: miri https://github.com/dtolnay/argv/issues/17#issuecomment-3201054937
43#[cfg(all(target_os = "linux", not(target_env = "musl"), not(miri)))]
44mod r#impl {
45    use crate::{CStr, OsStr, c_char, c_int};
46    use std::os::unix::ffi::OsStrExt;
47    use std::{mem, ptr};
48
49    static mut ARGC: c_int = 0;
50    static mut ARGV: *const *const c_char = ptr::null();
51
52    #[cfg(target_os = "linux")]
53    #[unsafe(link_section = ".init_array")]
54    #[used]
55    static CAPTURE: unsafe extern "C" fn(c_int, *const *const c_char) = capture;
56
57    // Disabled for now until we investigate https://github.com/dtolnay/argv/issues/1
58    #[cfg_attr(target_os = "macos", link_section = "__DATA,__mod_init_func")]
59    #[allow(dead_code)]
60    unsafe extern "C" fn capture(argc: c_int, argv: *const *const c_char) {
61        unsafe {
62            ARGC = argc;
63            ARGV = argv;
64        }
65    }
66
67    pub(crate) fn args_os_ref_iter() -> IterArgsOsRef {
68        // These are only mutated before main so they are safe to read once main
69        // has begun.
70        let argc = unsafe { ARGC };
71        let argv = unsafe { ARGV };
72
73        // We count on the OS to provide argv for which argv + argc does not
74        // overflow.
75        let end = unsafe { argv.offset(argc as isize) };
76
77        IterArgsOsRef { next: argv, end }
78    }
79
80    #[derive(Debug)]
81    pub(crate) struct IterArgsOsRef {
82        next: *const *const c_char,
83        end: *const *const c_char,
84    }
85
86    impl Iterator for IterArgsOsRef {
87        type Item = &'static OsStr;
88
89        fn next(&mut self) -> Option<Self::Item> {
90            if ptr::eq(self.next, self.end) {
91                None
92            } else {
93                let ptr = unsafe { *self.next };
94                let c_str = unsafe { CStr::from_ptr(ptr) };
95                self.next = unsafe { self.next.offset(1) };
96                Some(OsStr::from_bytes(c_str.to_bytes()))
97            }
98        }
99
100        fn size_hint(&self) -> (usize, Option<usize>) {
101            let len = self.len();
102            (len, Some(len))
103        }
104    }
105
106    impl ExactSizeIterator for IterArgsOsRef {
107        fn len(&self) -> usize {
108            (self.end as usize - self.next as usize) / mem::size_of::<*const c_char>()
109        }
110    }
111
112    // Thread safe despite the raw pointers.
113    unsafe impl Send for IterArgsOsRef {}
114    unsafe impl Sync for IterArgsOsRef {}
115}
116
117#[cfg(any(not(target_os = "linux"), target_env = "musl", miri))]
118mod r#impl {
119    use crate::{Once, OsStr};
120    use std::{env, iter, ptr, slice};
121
122    static ONCE: Once = Once::new();
123    static mut ARGV: Vec<&'static OsStr> = Vec::new();
124
125    pub(crate) fn args_os_ref_iter() -> IterArgsOsRef {
126        ONCE.call_once(|| {
127            let argv = env::args_os()
128                .map(|arg| -> &OsStr { Box::leak(arg.into_boxed_os_str()) })
129                .collect();
130            unsafe { ARGV = argv }
131        });
132        let argv = unsafe { &*ptr::addr_of!(ARGV) };
133        argv.iter().copied()
134    }
135
136    pub(crate) type IterArgsOsRef = iter::Copied<slice::Iter<'static, &'static OsStr>>;
137}
138
139const _AUTO_TRAITS: () = {
140    fn assert_send<T: Send>() {}
141    fn assert_sync<T: Sync>() {}
142
143    let _ = assert_send::<IterArgsOsRef>;
144    let _ = assert_sync::<IterArgsOsRef>;
145};
